subject: Investing
title: Dividend Growth vs. High Yield
description: One-minute skill: Dividend Growth vs. High Yield.

hook.text: Stock A yields 2% but grows dividends 12% a year. Stock B yields 6% but never raises. Who wins long-term?

buildup.text: High-yield stocks provide more income today. Dividend growth stocks provide more income over time.

discovery.text: After about 10 years, the growing 2% yield surpasses the flat 6% yieldâ€”and keeps accelerating from there.

twist.text: High-yield stocks often come with higher risk: cyclical businesses, debt-heavy firms, or companies in decline.

climax.text: For retirees needing income now, high yield matters. For accumulators, dividend growth wins decisively.

punchline.text: High yield is tempting today. Dividend growth is rewarding forever.

quiz.question: When does a lower-yield dividend growth stock typically surpass a high-yield flat stock?
